alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 23 at 4:03AM CST until February 23 at 1:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST /9 AM CST/ THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM MST /9 AM CST/ THIS MORNING TO NOON MST /1 PM CST/ TODAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills as low as 24 below are expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Kansas, east central and northeast Colorado and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 2 AM MST /3 AM CST/ to 8 AM MST /9 AM CST/ Wednesday. The Wind Chill Advisory remains in effect until noon MST/ 1pm CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be sure to dress in layers along with a coat and hat for the morning commute to work and school.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
